solution_line_template: She orders {num_scoops} scoops of ice cream that's ${ice_cream_cost_per_scoop} per scoop so the ice cream costs {num_scoops}*{ice_cream_cost_per_scoop} = $<<{num_scoops}*{ice_cream_cost_per_scoop}={ice_cream_total}>>{ice_cream_total}.
She wants double syrup. The syrup is ${syrup_cost_per} so that will cost {num_syrups}*{syrup_cost_per} = $<<{num_syrups}*{syrup_cost_per}={syrup_total}>>{syrup_total}.

The brownie is ${brownie_cost}, the ice cream will be ${ice_cream_total}, the syrup will be ${syrup_total} and the nuts will be ${nuts_cost} bringing her total to {brownie_cost}+{ice_cream_total}+{syrup_total}+{nuts_cost} = $<<{brownie_cost}+{ice_cream_total}+{syrup_total}+{nuts_cost}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}.
